item.title: 美国将三家中国公司列入需要额外出口检查的 "未经核实名单
item.description: 美国商务部周二将三家中国公司列入官员无法检查的接受美国出口产品的公司名单。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department on Tuesday added three companies in China to a list of firms receiving U.S. exports that officials have been unable to inspect.】

item.title: 嘉信理财第三季度利润因资产管理费增加而大幅增长
item.description: 周二，受资产管理费飙升和客户资产创历史新高的推动，经纪公司嘉信理财（Charles Schwab）第三季度净收入增长约 25%，使其股价在盘前交易中上涨超过 9%。【原文：Brokerage firm Charles Schwab's third-quarter net income rose about 25% on Tuesday, driven by a jump in asset management fees and client assets hitting a record high, sending its shares up more than 9% in premarket trading.】

item.title: StanChart 在有关 Libor 替代率的英国法庭案件中部分胜诉
item.description: 周二，渣打银行在伦敦一家法院的诉讼中胜诉，取代了其用于确定部分股票股息率的金融基准，这是渣打银行从 Libor 过渡的一个早期案例。【原文：Standard Chartered won its bid in a London court on Tuesday to replace the financial benchmark it used to set dividend rates for some shares, in an early case over the transition away from Libor.】

item.title: 利息收入减少、准备金增加导致 PNC Financial 季度利润下降
item.description: 本周二，PNC Financial 公布第三季度净利润下降 4%，原因是该公司从客户利息支付中获得的收入减少，并预留了更大的缓冲资本，以应对在经济不确定的情况下可能无法偿还的贷款。【原文：PNC Financial reported a 4% drop in third-quarter net profit on Tuesday, as it earned less from customer interest payment and set aside a bigger buffer of capital to cover loans that may not be repaid in an uncertain economy.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，英国 SSE 拒绝了 EDP 的合并提议
item.description: 三位熟悉内情的人士告诉路透社，葡萄牙主要电力公司 EDP 今年早些时候与在伦敦上市的同行 SSE 展开了合并讨论，但谈判没有取得进展。【原文：Portugal's main power utility EDP initiated merger discussions with London-listed peer SSE earlier this year, but talks did not progress, three people with familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: Platinum Equity 旗下 Ingram Micro 在美国首次公开募股中寻求最高 54 亿美元的估值
item.description: 由私募股权支持的技术产品分销商英迈（Ingram Micro）周二表示，其在美国首次公开募股的目标估值高达 54.2 亿美元。【原文：Ingram Micro is targeting a valuation of as much as $5.42 billion in its initial public offering in the United States, the private equity-backed technology products distributor said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 瑞银将标普 500 指数年底目标上调至 5850 点
item.description: 瑞银全球研究公司（UBS Global Research）周二将基准 S&P 500 指数的年终目标从早先预计的 5600 点上调至 5850 点，原因是受到企业利润增长、宏观经济背景支持和降息的提振。【原文：UBS Global Research on Tuesday raised its year-end target for the benchmark S&P 500 index to 5,850 points from an earlier projection of 5,600, boosted by corporate profit growth, supportive macro-economic backdrop and interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 花旗集团利润因潜在贷款损失库存增加而下降
item.description: 花旗集团的利润在第三季度下降了 9%，因为它预留了更多的资金来应对可能无法偿还的贷款，尤其是信用卡贷款。【原文：Citigroup's profit fell 9% in the third quarter as it set aside more money to cover loans that may not be repaid, particularly on credit cards.】

item.title: 瑞波币推出新稳定币，挑战行业巨头
item.description: 加密货币公司瑞波（Ripple）周二推出了一种与美元挂钩的稳定币，希望能颠覆一个由前两大主流货币占据近 90% 价值的市场。【原文：Crypto firm Ripple launched a stablecoin pegged to the U.S. dollar on Tuesday, looking to disrupt a market in which the top two incumbents account for nearly 90% of the value.】

item.title: 巴西航空工业公司伊夫公司获得巴西国家经济发展银行 8800 万美元贷款，用于建设第一家工厂
item.description: 电动飞机制造商伊夫（Eve）周二发表声明称，该公司已与巴西国家开发银行（BNDES）达成一项 8800 万美元的贷款协议，为其首个生产设施的开发提供资金。【原文：Electric aircraft maker Eve has secured an $88 million loan deal with Brazil's state development bank BNDES to fund the development of its first production facility, it said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 高盛投资银行业务强劲，利润跃升 45
item.description: 由于投资银行受益于交易反弹，高盛第三季度利润猛增 45%。【原文：Goldman Sachs' profit jumped 45% in the third quarter as the investment bank benefited from a rebound in dealmaking.】

item.title: 沃尔格林首席执行官温特沃斯寻求扭亏为盈，将关闭 1200 家门店
item.description: 沃尔格林博姿联盟（Walgreens Boots Alliance）周二表示，将在未来三年内关闭 1200 家门店，因为新任首席执行官蒂姆-温特沃斯（Tim Wentworth）计划扭转这家受消费者支出疲软和药品报销率低影响而陷入困境的连锁药店运营商的局面。【原文：Walgreens Boots Alliance said on Tuesday it would shut 1,200 stores over the next three years as new CEO Tim Wentworth plots a turnaround at the struggling pharmacy chain operator hit by sluggish consumer spending and low drug reimbursement rates.】

item.title: 波音公司提交证券登记声明，股票销售额高达 250 亿美元
item.description: 波音公司周二向美国市场监管机构提交了一份注册声明，允许这家飞机制造商通过发行各种债务证券和股票筹集高达 250 亿美元的资金。【原文：Boeing filed a registration statement with the U.S. markets regulator on Tuesday that will allow the planemaker to raise up to $25 billion through an offering of various debt securities and classes of stock.】

item.title: 美国银行利润因利息收入减少而下降
item.description: 本周二，美国银行公布第三季度利润下降，原因是客户利息支付收入减少。【原文：Bank of America reported a drop in third-quarter profit on Tuesday, as its income from customer interest payments shrank.】

item.title: 波音公司与银行达成 100 亿美元信贷协议
item.description: 波音公司周二表示，它已与一个银行财团达成了价值 100 亿美元的信贷协议，这家美国飞机制造商正在准备融资渠道，以应对瘫痪的罢工和即将到期的债务。【原文：Boeing said on Tuesday it has entered a credit agreement worth $10 billion with a consortium of banks, as the U.S. planemaker readies financing sources amid a crippling strike and upcoming debt maturities.】

item.title: J&J 上调利润和销售预期，超出华尔街预期
item.description: 强生公司周二上调了 2024 年的利润和销售预期，此前该公司公布的肿瘤药物销售强劲，季度业绩超出华尔街预期。【原文：Johnson & Johnson raised its 2024 profit and sales forecasts on Tuesday after reporting strong sales of oncology drugs and quarterly results that beat Wall Street expectations.】

item.title: 投资者等待财报，期指涨跌不一；芯片股下滑
item.description: 周二，美国股指期货涨跌不一，因为在高盛（Goldman Sachs）和美国银行（Bank of America）等公司发布一系列季度财报之前，投资者在上一交易日反弹后稍事休息。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were mixed on Tuesday as investors took a breather after a rally in the previous session, ahead of a slew of quarterly results from companies including Goldman Sachs and Bank of America.】

item.title: 早间竞价：中国经济衰退，美国科技、银行业再创新高
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: UnitedHealth 第三季度医疗成本激增，股价下跌
item.description: 联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）周二报告称，第三季度医疗成本激增，该公司正努力应对政府降低保险业务支付以及医疗保健需求居高不下的问题，股价因此下跌 3%。【原文：UnitedHealth Group reported a surge in third-quarter medical costs on Tuesday, as the company struggled with lower government payments in its insurance business and persistently high demand for medical care, sending its shares 3% lower.】

item.title: 罢工进入第二个月，波音工厂工人将在西雅图举行集会
item.description: 波音工厂的工人将于周二在西雅图举行大型集会，要求获得更好的工资待遇，从而向新任首席执行官凯利-奥特伯格（Kelly Ortberg）施加更大的压力，以结束使这家陷入困境的飞机制造商进一步陷入财务危机的激烈罢工。【原文：Boeing factory workers will hold a large rally in Seattle on Tuesday to demand a better wage deal, mounting pressure on new CEO Kelly Ortberg to end a bitter strike that has plunged the troubled planemaker further into financial crisis.】

item.title: Netflix 新增用户可能放缓，增长战略成为焦点
item.description: 周四，Netflix 可能会公布其六个季度以来最慢的用户增长速度，因为密码共享打击带来的收益有所缓解，投资者正在寻找其新生广告收入业务正在加速的迹象。【原文：Netflix could report its slowest subscriber additions in six quarters on Thursday as gains from a password-sharing crackdown ease, with investors looking for signs its nascent ad revenue business is accelerating.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，《纽约时报》就内容使用问题向人工智能初创公司 Perplexity 发出 "停止和终止 "通知
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二报道，《纽约时报》已向生成式人工智能初创公司 Perplexity 发出 "停止和终止 "通知，要求该公司停止使用其内容。【原文：The New York Times has sent generative AI startup Perplexity a "cease and desist" notice demanding the company stop using its content, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利财富管理公司称，注重劳动力的美联储将继续降息
item.description: 摩根士丹利财富管理公司（Morgan Stanley Wealth Management）首席投资官表示，美国联邦储备委员会（Federal Reserve）将在 11 月份继续降息，但由于通胀不再加速降温，政策制定者正步履维艰。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve will continue cutting interest rates in November, but policymakers are walking a thin line as inflation is no longer cooling at an accelerated pace, Morgan Stanley Wealth Management's chief investment officer said.】

item.title: 电动汽车芯片制造商 Wolfspeed 将获得 7.5 亿美元的美国芯片资助
item.description: 美国商务部周二表示，Wolfspeed 公司将获得 7.5 亿美元的政府拨款，用于其在北卡罗来纳州新建的碳化硅晶圆制造厂，这使得这家美国芯片制造商的股价在收盘前上涨了 10%。【原文：Wolfspeed is set to receive $750 million in government grants for its new North Carolina silicon carbide wafer manufacturing plant facility, the U.S. Commerce Department said Tuesday, sending the U.S. chipmaker's shares up 10% before the bell.】

item.title: 欧元区经济出现一些增长迹象
item.description: 周二，欧元区经济出现了一些生机勃勃的迹象，一系列指标表明，这个一年多来一直在衰退边缘徘徊的集团的经济增长虽然不温不火，但仍然是积极的。【原文：The euro zone economy showed some signs of life on Tuesday with a raft of indicators pointing to lukewarm but still positive growth for a bloc that has been skirting a recession for over a year.】

item.title: 宝马首席执行官称欧洲必须取消汽油发动机禁令以减少对中国的依赖
item.description: 宝马公司首席执行官周二表示，欧洲必须取消从2035年起禁止新的化石燃料排放汽车的计划，以减少对中国电池供应链的依赖，并发挥其技术优势。【原文：Europe must cancel its plan to ban new fossil fuel-emitting cars from 2035 to reduce reliance on China's battery supply chain and play to its technological strengths, BMW's chief executive said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 马斯克对安巴尼的游说做出反应，称印度拍卖卫星频谱的任何举动都是 "史无前例 "的
item.description: 路透社报道称，竞争对手亿万富翁穆克什-安巴尼（Mukesh Ambani）正在游说印度采用拍卖方式，星链公司老板埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）对此回应说，印度拍卖卫星宽带频谱而不是分配频谱的做法将是 "史无前例的"。【原文：Starlink boss Elon Musk said a move by India to auction satellite broadband spectrum, and not allocate it, would be "unprecedented", reacting to a Reuters story that rival billionaire Mukesh Ambani was lobbying for the auction route.】

item.title: 中国经济 2024 年将增长 4.8%，未达目标：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，中国经济在2024年可能增长4.8%，低于政府的目标，2025年增长可能进一步降至4.5%，这将使决策者在考虑采取更多刺激措施时继续承受压力。【原文：China's economy is likely to expand 4.8% in 2024, undershooting the government's target, and growth could cool further to 4.5% in 2025, a Reuters poll showed, maintaining the pressure on policymakers as they consider more stimulus measures.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟 Discovery 将于 11 月在七个亚洲市场推出 Max 流媒体服务
item.description: 媒体巨头华纳兄弟探索公司（Warner Bros Discovery）周二表示，将于 11 月 19 日在亚洲 7 个市场推出 Max 流媒体服务，从而使该平台在超过 72 个市场可用。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery will launch its Max streaming service across seven Asian markets on Nov. 19, making the platform available in more than 72 markets, the media giant said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 全球投资者的乐观情绪出现自 2020 年 6 月以来的最大涨幅 - 美国银行
item.description: 美国银行周二公布的一项对基金经理的调查显示，由于美联储降息、对中国刺激政策的预期以及美国经济软着陆，10月份全球投资者的乐观情绪创下了2020年6月以来的最大涨幅。【原文：Global investor optimism scored the biggest jump since June 2020 in October due to Federal Reserve rate cuts, expectations of stimulus from China and of a soft landing for the U.S. economy, a BofA survey of fund mangers published on Tuesday showed.】
